meanings.definition: Resembling a gyroid in shape or form.
meanings.sent1: The gyroidal pattern on the wallpaper was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent2: The 3D printed object had a gyroidal design that caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The chef created a gyroidal cake that looked too beautiful to eat.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was styled in a gyroidal manner, twisting and turning elegantly.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a gyroidal landscape that seemed to come alive.

meanings.definition: Having the characteristics of a gyroid.
meanings.sent1: The material had a gyroidal texture that felt smooth to the touch.
meanings.sent2: The sculpture displayed a gyroidal shape that was both unique and intriguing.
meanings.sent3: The car's gyroidal paint job made it stand out in the parking lot.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a gyroidal quality, resonating with depth and richness.
meanings.sent5: The fabric had a gyroidal pattern that added a modern touch to the room.

meanings.definition: Involving or relating to a gyroid.
meanings.sent1: The gyroidal research project required advanced mathematical skills.
meanings.sent2: The gyroidal structure of the molecule fascinated the scientists.
meanings.sent3: The gyroidal discussion at the conference sparked new ideas among attendees.
meanings.sent4: His gyroidal approach to problem-solving was both innovative and effective.
meanings.sent5: The gyroidal analysis of the data revealed unexpected patterns.
